title: The WiFi Password Caper
setting: Pinnacle Tech Solutions, server room, Tuesday 8 AM
premise: Someone changed the office WiFi password overnight, locking everyone out. The router log shows the change was made at 11:47 PM Monday from a hardwired terminal in the server room.

suspects.name: Marcus Webb
suspects.motive: Angry about being passed over for promotion last week
suspects.alibi: I left the office at 6 PM sharp. I was at a bowling league at Sunset Lanes from 7 to 11 PM. My teammates can vouch for me.

suspects.name: Dana Ortiz
suspects.motive: Complained the WiFi name was offensive and wanted it changed
suspects.alibi: I worked late debugging until about 10 PM, then drove straight home. I live forty-five minutes away in Riverside and was home by 10:50.

suspects.name: Kyle Finnegan
suspects.motive: Wanted to prove the network security was weak
suspects.alibi: I was at home all evening. My wife and I watched a movie starting at 9 PM. I never came back to the office after leaving at 5:30.

suspects.name: Jess Nakamura
suspects.motive: Joked about 'resetting everything' after a frustrating sprint review
suspects.alibi: I stayed late finishing a report until around 11 PM. Then I took the elevator down to the parking garage and drove home.

clues.title: Night Security Log
clues.content: The security guard notes only two badge-ins after 9 PM on Monday: Jess at 6:15 PM (never badged out until 11:10 PM) and one re-entry at 11:30 PM.

clues.title: Parking Garage Footage
clues.content: Garage camera shows Dana's car leaving at 10:05 PM and not returning. Jess's car left at 11:12 PM. One car entered the garage at 11:25 PM.

clues.title: Bowling Alley Closing Time
clues.content: Sunset Lanes posts on their website that Monday leagues end at 10 PM and the building closes at 10:30 PM. Marcus claimed he was bowling until 11 PM.

hints.text: Check the timelines carefully -- do the hours each suspect claims actually add up?
Are there any venues mentioned whose operating hours might not match what someone claimed?
